lexUnit.name: screech.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.

sentence.text: But barn owls , famed in folklore for their eerie screech and ghostly white plumage , are declining in Britain .
The sound of the shot was drowned by the deafening screech and roar of the thing as its eye blew apart in a shattering viscous whirl of fluid and tissue .
The sounds of Danish mingled with those of knives drawn across a plate , the screech of jays , and the buzz and hum that rose from within her and ousted her tranquillity .
Pirate arrived with a screech of rusty Ford brakes without any acknowledgement of my huddled form sheltering by his fishboxes on the quay .
In the disputed territory , the Karelia or Sudetenland , between waking and sleeping , Charsky heard the distant screech of a violin and , close to him , a rustle of pages .
The taxi cab skidded to a halt with a screech of brakes .
I remember the screech of the horn and the blur of the car as it passed in front of me .
Charlie pushed it open slowly , expecting a volley of bullets to follow but the loudest sound they heard was the screech of the hinges .
Then only the slapping of waves against the hull , the creak and whine of timbers straining , the screech of gulls .
The distant ` woof of a dog or screech of a car engine would sound as intense as a Rachmaninoff concerto in a concert hall .
He shivered at the ` yip , yip " of a fox carried by the cool night wind and jumped at the screech of the huge bats which flickered up and down the castle walls .
Robyn let out a screech of frustration and stared down at her clothes .
With a screech of metal and a shower of falling masonry , the speeder suddenly jerked backwards .
Lighting another cigarette beneath his tree , listening to the screech of a shell going over the British line about half a mile south , Jack Firebrace began to tremble .
The screech of a jet will do nicely .
Lydia gave a screech of eldritch mirth .
The old woman let out a screech towards the door that led into the house .
Brian let out a hoarse screech at each cut .
There was a screech from within and an instant cacophony of barking and scolding broke out .
Suddenly there was a loud screech , and on the roof a wild peacock appeared .
For example , if you have sudden feedback with a microphone which produces a dreadful screech , 5,000 people will just laugh .
He imitated Colette 's intense screech .
It touched the ground at what appeared to be an impossible speed and skidded terrifyingly along the runway amid clouds of dust accompanied by a scraping , nerve-shattering , high-pitched screech .
